meanings.definition: To walk or march in a group.
meanings.sent1: The children were trooping happily to the playground.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were trooping in formation during the parade.
meanings.sent3: Trooping together, the ants formed a long line to carry food.
meanings.sent4: The stars were trooping across the night sky, shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: Trooping through the forest, the hikers enjoyed the fresh air and scenery.

meanings.definition: A group or company of people or animals.
meanings.sent1: A trooping of excited fans gathered outside the concert venue.
meanings.sent2: The trooping of elephants moved gracefully through the savanna.
meanings.sent3: The trooping of penguins waddled comically on the icy shore.
meanings.sent4: The trooping of clouds filled the sky, casting shadows below.
meanings.sent5: The trooping of friends made the hike more enjoyable and fun.
